author: theHulk655
title: Save yourself
review: Movie isn't worth watching. Save your time and money. Movie is boring slow and gives a free headache.

author: msdianforever
title: A Must Watch! Please read the full review.
review:
2018 has been a year of ups and down for Bollywood. While we've got masterpieces like Padman, Padmaavat, Andhadhun, Sanju, Tumbadd, Raazi etc. We've also got some films that are utter crap! And if you thought Race 3 was the worst of the year, you are wrong. Namaste London has beaten it!
The plot is senseless, in fact it makes me wonder why did they even think of making this movie. I don't have any words for the performances because nobody acted. Arjun Kapoor was horrible, I mean he's starring in a comedy film when he can't change a single expression! How did Vipul Shah even imagine him as a replacement for Akshay Kumar? Parineeti is annoying and her dialogues are one of the worst you'll ever hear.
There are some movies that are bad so you skip them but Namaste England comes in the category of films that you have to watch just to know how cringy Bollywood can get

author: roger6615
title: Fantastically wonderful movie
review: Wow what an amazing movie. Perfect story. Great acting. awesome dialogues. an Oscar performance. Totally believable plot. A must see for someone planning a quick exit from LIFE! Hats off to the writer, director, producers and c all involved in this film for successfully achieving the worst movie ever !

author: kinshuk-gaur
title: The best Horror movie ever.
review: I was itching to write something about this movie with 15 min into it. Trying hard to restrain myself, but after a pain striking hour watching this junk I was left wondering. Why? on earth I am watching the king of nepotism Arjun Kapoor and the puerile Parineeta performing their histrionics on screen.I was away from this movie to regain some sense and breath. I don't know what happened in that hour because it was scary. I got an impression of watching some get together scenes of a couple of people.I am sure of never being so magnificent in my writing ever. Please save yourself, this gives a sense of Armageddon.The best Horror movie ever.

author: elixir024
title: "Only comparable to RACE 3" in terms of worst film of the year
review:
The whole time I was thinking, how can the same director makes such a bad movie.
Man..I'm a bit optimistic that this movie will do well not because of the cast but the director is well known and gave few good movies(Holiday, Nameste London) in the past. But this movie, it's a total let you down. I seriously recommend to watch any good rom-com on Netflix or watch ANDHADHUN or TUMBBAD.
Bakwaas... "Utterly non-sense" movie of the year ONLY comparable to RACE 3.People who agree with me please vote Y or N. Thanks

author: sachinsalve-30049
title: A must miss film
review: This is a must miss film. Arjun Kapoor should work on his acting. We have many talented people in India but they merely get chance, and instead non talented people are served in our dish who torture us with their so called acting. Bollywood is developing & making masterpieces like Padman, Tumbbad, Andhadhun, and at this level you cannot come with a worthless acting & story. Work a little hard on acting and story, and we Indians will definitely support you. Please watch Namstey London instead of watching this movie.

author: SouravChakraborty_P1
title: Arjun Kapoor is giving tough competition to Jhanvi
review:
Horrible movie, what is wrong with Vipul, he used to make some quality movies like Aankhein, Namastey London.
he degraded so much, who gave him idea to make this crap, thank God Akshay didn't starred in this movie.
Arjun Kapoor is pathetic, no expression, zero acting, how can someone cast him, even people from dubsmash acts betetr than him, he is really giving tough competition to Jhanvi, I thought dhadak was the worst movie of this year, and she couldn't act at all, now Arjun is going to give tough competition to her.
Namastey London was a classic movie, a great story with emotions, comedy, a complete package
Namastey England might be on IMDB's bottom list soon.
Avoid
